content: Delete a file To remove a file from Git version control while keeping the local file. Add the file to .gitignore. Execute in command line: ​ ​ git rm file_path --cached ​ Commit: Delete the file from the git version: ​ ​ git commit -m "delete the file" ​
title: Delete a Git File or Folder While Keeping the Local Ones

content: Delete a folder To remove a folder from Git version control while retaining the local folder, add the -r argument: ​ git rm -r folder_path --cached To remove all files in .gitignore from version control, you need to remove all files first, and then do the following to add all files. ​ git rm -r . --cached ​ git add . This way, files in gitignore will be ignored.
title: Delete a Git File or Folder While Keeping the Local Ones
